It's also possible to perform "offline" transactions such as exchanging BitBills or otherwise exchanging keypairs rather than coins. Since these transactions do not appear on the network until the BitBill (or other device) is "redeemed" by sending coins to a new address, they are no more traceable than cash transactions. Even purchasing a bitbill with one wallet and then redeeming it on another adds plausible deniability.
